snippet: The decision was the latest in a series of Supreme Court decisions suggesting a pattern of prosecutorial misconduct in Louisiana’s Orleans Parish District Attorney’s Office.
abstract: Supreme Court reverses murder conviction of New Orleans man Juan Smith, convicted of killing five people in 1995, saying prosecutors withheld evidence that his lawyers could have used in his defense; decision is latest in series of Supreme Court decisions suggesting pattern of prosecutorial misconduct in Louisiana's Orleans Parish District Attorney's Office.
lead_paragraph: The decision was the latest in a series of Supreme Court decisions suggesting a pattern of prosecutorial misconduct in Louisiana’s Orleans Parish District Attorney’s Office.

headline.seo: Supreme Court Cites Withheld Evidence in Reversing Conviction
headline.main: High Court Reverses Conviction in Killings
headline.print_headline: High Court Reverses Conviction In Killings
